ygData.messageBody:
>Hello again all. I've recently arrived in Freeport and intend on staying
>there for a while. However, my level 4 cleric can't yet use the spell Bind
>Affinity, and I'm having trouble finding someone who can (or will) bind me
to
>the town. If anyone is located around there and has the spell, or knows
>someone who does, please drop me a line, (I'm Fenwen in game).

Look for Drugar and Anaxia ( both dwarven clerics). They will charge you
about 1 plat or so, but you can try to bargain with them. Also, you can
always to a /who all 12 cl, or /who all 12 ma (and whatever druid is)... and
that will give you a list of the people at the levels with bind. (Though
many, like Drugar, are anonymous and won't show up).

>And for those of you who like hellish stories, here's one for you;
>
>I make the journey from Felwithe all the way to Freeport without much
>trouble. I'm wandering around the outsides of Freeport, and I see an asp. I
>say, there's low-level stuff around here, it can't be that hard. Well,
killed
>me in three hits, needless to say. So, I get sent back to Felwithe. I make
it
>all the way to the docks at Kaladim, catch the boat, and I'm on my way
again.
>This isn't so bad, I tell myself. Wrong again. I accidentally hit the
windows
>key and get thrown out of EQ. I log back on, only to find myself wading in
>the Ocean of Tears, miles away from my destination, with my corpse slowing
>decaying. So, I says to myself, what now? Well, I decided to swim for it. I
>make it from 210, 300 to about 210, -8000 (An hour swim, adding in the fact
I
>swam in circles for a good half hour) and I see a boat heading for me
>straight on. I get a crafty idea and swim right into it - and right into
the
>hold! But, it's going the wrong way.. it takes me back to Kaladim! So I
wait
>the trip out and finally arrive in Freeport. I run all the way to where I
>died, and my corpse is, amazingly, still there. I've never been so
frustrated
>in my life.


Yes, if you lose connection on a boat, you log back in in the ocean. Or, if
you are very lucky, like me, you'll log in in a nonexistent spot, and fall
off the map, ending up under the earth in Butcherblock, unable to get to
your corpes. A GM got it back for me (about 9 hours later), but it shouldn't
have happened in the first place.

I asked the GM if they were going to fix the thing were you log back in from
the water, and he was like, 'No, I think that's the way it should be - it is
a dangerous trip!' Well, I totally disagree. To me, if losing link is like
'passing out' in the virtual world. If you pass out while fighting a
monster, you'll die. If you pass out while standing in a field, you'll be
standing in a field. If you pass out on a boat - you should still be on the
boat when you wake up!! The idea that you'd end up in the water is
ridiculous.

Scylla
